metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14833 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Samba, all versions starting samba 4.5.0 before samba4.9.15, samba 4.10.10, samba 4.11.2, in the way it handles a user passwordchange or a new password for a samba user. The Samba Active DirectoryDomain Controller can be configured to use a custom script to check forpassword complexity. This configuration can fail to verify passwordcomplexity when non-ASCII characters are used in the password, which couldlead to weak passwords being set for samba users, making it vulnerable todictionary attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14833` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.13').
